title: What is the name of this font, and is it available for DL - "money font"?
content:
hey sorry i dont have a better picture but does anyone know what this font is? the big one, the JR  
i heard it's the "money font" but the real name would be awesome  
 [http://www.williamgaddis.org/imagesbkcovers/jr1stUSt.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20111229204724/http:/www.williamgaddis.org/imagesbkcovers/jr1stUSt.jpg "http://www.williamgaddis.org/imagesbkcovers/jr1stUSt.jpg")

thanks in advance  
sami
author: dtcf

comments.content:
Check out [this thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20111229204724/http:/www.typophile.com/node/13666) about the dollar bill font.

How old is your sample?

- Lex

^^thanks for the info lexluthor  
i just looked at the dollar bill font and it helpeda bit but the first two fonts, woodcut and barrelhouse didnt work.

the sample is pretty old i guess, the book came out in 1974 and i think that image is from the first press run. i have a copy of the book with that in much bigger...anyways if thats what youre referring tpo (im a n00bie) it's pretty old. i know it's designed to look exactly like money though  
thanks again  
sami

If the sample is that old, chances are it's been hand-drawn.

- Lex
that's what i figured, although there's got to be at least a real similar font around now because it's the money font

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dtptypes/engravers-dt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20111229204724/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dtptypes/engravers-dt/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dtptypes/engravers-dt/")  
This font is similar to your sample, if you are handy with Illustrator you could alter it to work. However, your sample is not the same as that used on a dollar bill the leg of the R is radically different.  
Tim
